title: Red and Black
medium: oil on canvas laid down on board
provenance_text:
Carl-Henning Pedersen [1913-2007], Copenhagen, Denmark. Unidentified [1]; James L. Winokur [1922-2009], Pittsburgh, PA, by June 1968 [2]; partial gifts to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute (subsequently Carnegie Museum of Art,) Pittsburgh, PA, 1977 to 1995 [3].

Notes:
[1]. See note [2] below.
[2]. James Winokur purchased the painting through Leon Arkus, who bought a similar painting at the same time, from an unidentified source. The purchase price was $5,800. See copy of memorandum from Reed Smith Shaw & McClay, dated December 11, 1985, in curatorial file (date of payment for the purchase given as 1969.) See also copy of correspondence dated June 17, 1968 in curatorial file. Mr. and Mrs. WInokur lent the painting to "Exhibition of Paintings, Watercolors, and Drawings by Carl-Henning Pedersen" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh PA, October - December 1968 (no. 62, illustrated in the catalogue and dated 1959.)
[3]. The painting was accessioned as a 1977 year-end partial gift on February 9, 1978. The painting arrived at the museum as intended loan on May 10, 1995. Committee action on completion of the gift as a 1995 year-end gift was taken on December 7, 1995.
